---
title: Spacing
description: Overview of the space scale and spacing tokens in Apsara.
---

Consistent spacing creates visual rhythm and hierarchy in your interface. Apsara provides a comprehensive spacing scale through CSS custom properties that you can use throughout your application.

## Scale

Spacing values are derived from a 17-step scale, which provides fine-grained control over layout spacing. The scale starts at 2px and progressively increases to 120px, allowing for both tight and spacious layouts.

<TokenTable
  type="spacing"
  tokens={[
    { name: "--rs-space-1", value: "2px", description: "Minimal spacing, icon gaps" },
    { name: "--rs-space-2", value: "4px", description: "Tight spacing, small gaps" },
    { name: "--rs-space-3", value: "8px", description: "Compact padding, inline spacing" },
    { name: "--rs-space-4", value: "12px", description: "Standard small padding" },
    { name: "--rs-space-5", value: "16px", description: "Default padding, common gaps" },
    { name: "--rs-space-6", value: "20px", description: "Medium padding" },
    { name: "--rs-space-7", value: "24px", description: "Comfortable spacing" },
    { name: "--rs-space-8", value: "28px", description: "Generous padding" },
    { name: "--rs-space-9", value: "32px", description: "Large spacing" },
    { name: "--rs-space-10", value: "40px", description: "Section gaps" },
    { name: "--rs-space-11", value: "48px", description: "Large section spacing" },
    { name: "--rs-space-12", value: "56px", description: "Extra large spacing" },
    { name: "--rs-space-13", value: "64px", description: "Major divisions" },
    { name: "--rs-space-14", value: "72px", description: "Layout spacing" },
    { name: "--rs-space-15", value: "80px", description: "Page sections" },
    { name: "--rs-space-16", value: "96px", description: "Large page sections" },
    { name: "--rs-space-17", value: "120px", description: "Maximum spacing" },
  ]}
/>

## Tokens

Space scale tokens can be accessed using CSS variables. Use these tokens to style your custom components, ensuring they are consistent with the rest of your theme.

```css
/* Space scale */
var(--rs-space-1);   /* 2px */
var(--rs-space-2);   /* 4px */
var(--rs-space-3);   /* 8px */
var(--rs-space-4);   /* 12px */
var(--rs-space-5);   /* 16px */
var(--rs-space-6);   /* 20px */
var(--rs-space-7);   /* 24px */
var(--rs-space-8);   /* 28px */
var(--rs-space-9);   /* 32px */
var(--rs-space-10);  /* 40px */
var(--rs-space-11);  /* 48px */
var(--rs-space-12);  /* 56px */
var(--rs-space-13);  /* 64px */
var(--rs-space-14);  /* 72px */
var(--rs-space-15);  /* 80px */
var(--rs-space-16);  /* 96px */
var(--rs-space-17);  /* 120px */
```

## Semantic Groupings

The spacing scale can be organized into semantic groups for easier selection:

<TokenTable
  tokens={[
    { name: "Compact", value: "2px - 8px", description: "Tight UI elements, icon spacing (tokens 1-3)" },
    { name: "Comfortable", value: "12px - 24px", description: "Standard component padding (tokens 4-7)" },
    { name: "Spacious", value: "28px - 48px", description: "Section spacing, larger gaps (tokens 8-11)" },
    { name: "Layout", value: "56px - 120px", description: "Page sections, major divisions (tokens 12-17)" },
  ]}
/>

## Best Practices

- **Use smaller values (1-5)** for internal component spacing like padding and gaps between inline elements
- **Use medium values (5-9)** for spacing between related components and within sections
- **Use larger values (10-17)** for spacing between sections and major layout divisions
- **Be consistent** - use the same spacing token for similar contexts throughout your application
- **Avoid mixing** pixel values with spacing tokens to maintain consistency
